comments.body: Yes i was getting on here to make this exact suggestion it needs to be done it's so small and so simple but would help a lot
Maybe instead of using gold netherite? Just an idea.
@RoseCullen256 Good Idea! You could possibly upgrade it like you would tools instead of surrounding it. I agree that it would be too easy to get with gold. Thanks for the idea!
Yes, i dont like how different slabs f l o a t on top of eachother

Maybe the gold could have a separate durability bar, that depletes more quickly than the armor's original durability, and could break off eventually? I love the idea! Now that I think about it, they could do a lot with the smithing table's new functionality.
Tirado the red, you are right, when they finish the attribute system there are endless possibilities, add suger and it has more speed. Add a golden apple and more health, theres so much you could do

Wait, "finish" the attribute system, meaning they're working on one? Sweet!

I wonder if it'd be cool if you could use certain items on weapons to change their "style" - I.e., their appearance, cooldown time, and damage, almost like a rebalancing tool for enhancing certain play styles.
There already is an attribute system it just isn’t finished
I'd love to have a gold plated guard on a sword. It'd look incredibly cool.

Why only iron? Why not give existing Golden Tools a new feature?
My extension of this idea would be that you could combine Golden Tools with other tools together in the anvil, and that tool, let's say it's a Netherrite pickaxe, is then gold-plated for a certain duration (i.e. not permanently!) and in the case of the pickaxe could degrade faster. So you have a gold-plated Netherrite pickaxe that you can combine with a golden pickaxe, so that the Netherrite pickaxe is more efficient for a certain period of time.
Maybe just being able to warp the direction of the pearl is better like getting out of corners but it would take a lot of coding
maybe instead you use it for crafting teleporters
So, what does it do.
I think it would be interesting if there was a shield enchantment, the shield will only block all damage if it has the enchantment.
Wow
Wow

I've thought this since the beginning. Llama wool is a thing in real life (even Sims 4 has llama wool!). This would be especially useful when sheep are hard to come by in a biome, and you have roaming llamas instead

I don’t think the stone breaking apart into little stones when you mine stone is a good idea. However, I think you should be able to get like 4 small stones like the ones you mentioned above when you put stone in the crafting table or that new saw thing.

I think it should be called rock or pebble, and could be fired from a slingshot made from 4 sticks and 1 string. It does 6 damage max, but can only go half the distance of an arrow. They would be dropped in amounts of 4 per ore broken or found loose on caves and the ground. 4 of them could be crafted into a block of cobble. 4 Gravel could also be made into 1 cobble.
Cool idea but I don’t think it should be added because it would ruin builds.
Nah it would enhance builds by giving them a sense of being part of a living world

I disagree, and I think this behavior should ONLY happen to bricks that are placed next to Moss blocks, or if you're using bonemeal on moss next to bricks or cobblestone.

When you're a prolific builder in charge of a full server, you have better things to do than "upkeep" and cleaning moss.
Plus, you wouldn't be able to remove the moss on bricks like you can remove vines growing too long. You'd have to break the blocks, and in case of ceiling blocks, that'd also require breaking things hanging from it...
The game doesn't need annoying features to be added.
This would be very impractical.
But there would be a new decoration block, though.
They could feature in clusters in other biomes too, to fill the gaps between trees.
Yes good idea but maybe make them have a lot of leaves otherwise they would look too similar to oak sapling.
I know right, when I'm playing skywars or some other sort of void incorporated game, I can't ender pearl back up if I fall because the ender pearl is way too slow.
I think if they add this, it would make saving yourself easier and getting away faster.
Me encontraba pensando lo mismo, es realmente una idea excelente

I think a basket is a great idea, but instead of working like a bundle it would be like this: 

basket made from bamboo 

basket and mud crafted together makes mud-lined basket , which works like a bucket. (cannot hold lava or mobs, but can hold water)
Seems very useful mate good on ya
when i first read the title i thought it would be just thrown on mobs like normal potions but i see how that would be a lot more useful version of the affect.
Or better, you glow if you drink it. Splash potion for mobs.

I think crayons might be a bit too modern for minecraft. And I think candles would be much too similar to sea pickles because they give off light. I support the idea of wax I just believe it should be used for other things.

I disagree with the crayons, they don't feel right for a game with swords, shield and magical creatures. Also, I think that the wax should come from bees, like the wax used in candles in the real world.
I primarily support wax (or honeycombs for that matter) as a way to protect copper from aging. If it has other functions as well, so be it.
Wax would be obtained by firing a honeycomb in a furnace. Candles, waxed copper blocks, and wax blocks should be made with it.

Ya know chisel and bits mod is cool but i bean wanting CRAYONS to bee in the game so i can make a custom block or a bucket of paint to instantly color the side of a block oh and also make it so you can dye the crayons and bucket of paint and also make it so you can erase it please
Very interesting, I have seen a mod having bamboo blocks so looking at that it would be insanely cool for tropical purposes!
This would make great use of all the extra fish I get from fishing. Voted. Fantastic idea.
Maybe the Yellow Pepper, would give slightly less hunger but can be eaten faster, and the red giving more but eating slower. Orange would be the middle ground.
There should be a 1 in a 2,000 chance for a purple bell to be given when harvested that gives a bit more hunger bars.
No, no wood out of cactus, cacti are very flimsy. But stripped cactus is a good idea. Maybe you could craft stripped cactus into fruit and eat it because it doesn't have its thorns.

I think a green wood variant from cactus would be a really interesting addition! maybe when you strip a cactus you could get aloe, which can be used in potions. Cause aloe vera is usually used to treat sunburn, but fire resistance and regeneration are already potions, maybe it could be used to make a potion that prevents negative status effects?

Since Cacti aren't the best for building with, they should be able to break by just standing on them, they should slowly deteriorate with time of being stood on. This would correspond to reality. Maybe they also could have some Redstone functionality, like breaking with a Redstone signal.

I agree that having it have some function in terms of breaking would make sense, but as a decorative block, I think having it decay over time wouldn't be very fun for players to deal with. Why bother getting a block if it's so easy to accidentally destroy? I do think making it break with a redstone pulse would be a really good idea though. I'd say the blocks should also be much quicker to mine than all other wood variants

Well "Stripped cactus" should stop items like for instance, sharpness 5 unbreaking 3 smite 2 fire aspect 2 netherite sword from being destroyed by some little half heart thorns. Cactus should NOT DEMOLISH a netherite ingot forged from GOLD and ANCEINT DEBRE PLUE CACTUS DOESENT DESTROY THE AXR THAT TOUCHES IT WHEN YOU MINE IT!!! >:(

Daxcoolkid13's Idea
They could also be used as food for camels, while camels could eat cacti it would cause them a little damage. and no wood out of cacti

No. Iron and gold are already too valuable and moderated with not being affected by Fortune, necessary for anvils & rails/carts. What you’re implying entails possible degrading of iron in the environment; blocks, tools you left in the grass, infrastructure. I doubt you want that kind of grind for maintenance & more resources to replace tracks.
It could rust similar to how the new Copper oxidizes, as just a visual effect, and it can be stopped with Honeycomb.
Coral blocks are the some of the most beautiful blocks in the game, and I would love to be able to figure out how to farm them for future builds.
Lava is too hot for ordinary glass so I think it would be nice to add quartz bowls or something, and you can already put lava there.
You will have the ability to stack different cubes on top of each other.

I was thinking of suggesting this. I think it is actually a good idea, but we'd need many or the construction blocks to be made into their cube variants. A machine that turns 1 block into 8 cubes works.
I think smaller blocks are possible, but I think putting multiple small blocks of different types would put a lot of stress on the game's engine.
Where would we get it and what would it look like.
*Stonks man* Affesant
It should go up to Level 5 like Efficiency.
I think Minecraft needs more Curses, and this is exactly a great idea. I think any tool with Inefficiency would be unable to be enchanted with Efficiency as well, until the curse was removed.
